name: Grand Palace & Wat Phra Kaew
thaiName: พระบรมมหาราชวังและวัดพระศรีรัตนศาสดาราม
description: Thailand's most sacred site, home to the Emerald Buddha and a stunning complex of royal buildings showcasing Thai architecture at its finest.
imageCredits: Images from The Grand Palace Official Website (royalgrandpalace.th)
imageCreditsTh: ภาพจากเว็บไซต์ทางการพระบรมมหาราชวัง (royalgrandpalace.th)
address: Na Phra Lan Road, Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang, Phra Nakhon, Bangkok 10200
dressCode: STRICT: Long pants/skirts (below knee), covered shoulders. NO tank tops, shorts, ripped jeans, or leggings. Scarves NOT accepted as shoulder cover.
highlights: Ramakien Mural Gallery (longest in the world)
Royal Changing of Robes Ceremony (3 times/year)
tips: Arrive early (08:30-09:00) to avoid crowds and heat.
Ticket includes Queen Sirikit Museum and Khon performance (within 7 days).
Beware of scams claiming 'temple closed' - it's open daily.
Photography prohibited inside Emerald Buddha chapel.
Clothing rental available at entrance (limited during peak hours).

transportation.detail: Sanam Chai Station (BL31), Exit 1, walk 5 mins.
Chao Phraya Express to Tha Chang Pier (N9).

name: Wat Pho (Temple of the Reclining Buddha)
thaiName: วัดพระเชตุพนวิมลมังคลาราม
description: Thailand's first university and UNESCO Memory of the World site, famous for its 46-meter Reclining Buddha and traditional Thai massage school.
address: 2 Sanam Chai Road, Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang, Phra Nakhon, Bangkok 10200
dressCode: Respectful attire required. Shoulders and knees must be covered.
tips: Visit at 17:00-18:00 for evening chanting ceremony.
Book massage early - queues can be 1-2 hours long.
Thai Massage: 480-520 THB/hour, Herbal Compress: 720 THB/hour.
Explore beyond the Reclining Buddha - the complex has many hidden gems.

transportation.detail: Sanam Chai Station (BL31), Exit 1, walk 5 mins.
Chao Phraya Express to Tha Tien Pier (N8), walk 2 mins.
Cross-river ferry from Wat Arun (5 THB).

name: Wat Arun (Temple of Dawn)
thaiName: วัดอรุณราชวราราม
description: Bangkok's most iconic riverside temple, featuring an 82-meter Khmer-style prang decorated with colorful Chinese porcelain. Fully restored in 2025.
address: 158 Thanon Wang Doem, Wat Arun, Bangkok Yai, Bangkok 10600
dressCode: Respectful attire required. Shoulders and knees must be covered.
highlights: 82m Central Prang with steep climbing stairs
Best sunset views from across the river
Thai costume rental for photoshoots (popular trend)
tips: Despite the name 'Dawn', best photos are at late afternoon/sunset.
Climb the prang carefully - stairs are very steep.
Rent traditional Thai costume nearby for Instagram-worthy photos.
Cross from Wat Pho via ferry (5 THB) for scenic approach.

transportation.detail: Itsaraphap Station (BL32), Exit 2, walk 10-12 mins or motorbike taxi.
Chao Phraya Express to Wat Arun Pier (N8).
Cross-river ferry from Tha Tien (Wat Pho side), 5 THB.

name: Raan Jay Fai
description: Legendary street food stall awarded a Michelin star, famous for its crab omelet and the chef's iconic goggles.
address: 327 Mahachai Road, Samran Rat, Phra Nakhon, Bangkok 10200
highlights: Watching Jay Fai cook with charcoal fire
tips: Queue can be very long (2-4 hours). Booking in advance is recommended.
Pricey for street food but portions are huge.
Cash only.

transportation.detail: Take MRT Blue Line to Sam Yot Station (Exit 1), walk 10 mins.
Convenient apps to avoid taxi refusal. Set destination to 'Raan Jay Fai'.
Motorbike taxi from Golden Mount or Khaosan Road (approx. 40-60 THB).

name: After You Dessert Cafe
thaiName: อาฟเตอร์ ยู
description: Thailand's most famous dessert cafe chain, beloved for its Shibuya Honey Toast and Kakigori (shaved ice).
address: Various locations (Siam Paragon, Central World, etc.)
tips: Siam Paragon branch usually has the longest queue.
Try the seasonal menus (Durian, Mango, Strawberry).
Free tea is provided.

transportation.detail: Take BTS to Siam Station (Exit 3 for Siam Paragon).
Take BTS to Chit Lom Station (for Central World).

name: Wat Saket (Golden Mount)
thaiName: วัดสระเกศราชวรมหาวิหาร
description: Climb 344 steps to the top of Bangkok's Golden Mount for stunning 360-degree panoramic views of the old city and modern skyline.
address: 344 Thanon Chakkraphatdi Phong, Ban Bat, Pom Prap Sattru Phai, Bangkok 10100
entranceFee: 100 THB (Foreigners, for climbing the mount), Free (Temple grounds)
dressCode: Respectful attire required. Shoulders and knees must be covered.
highlights: 77m high artificial hill with golden chedi
344 gentle spiral steps with bells to ring
Annual Temple Fair during Loy Krathong (November)
tips: Visit at sunset for best views and cooler temperature.
Stairs are gentle and easy to climb - suitable for all ages.
Ring the bells along the way for good luck.
Annual Loy Krathong festival here is one of Bangkok's biggest.

transportation.detail: Sam Yot Station (BL30), walk 15 mins.
Most convenient option from hotels.

name: Wat Suthat & Giant Swing
thaiName: วัดสุทัศนเทพวราราม
description: One of Bangkok's most beautiful temples with perfect Rattanakosin architecture, standing before the iconic red Giant Swing.
address: 146 Bamrung Mueang Road, Wat Ratchabophit, Phra Nakhon, Bangkok 10200
dressCode: Respectful attire required. Shoulders and knees must be covered.
highlights: Phra Sri Sakyamuni - massive Sukhothai-era bronze Buddha
Giant Swing (Sao Ching Cha) - 21m tall red structure
Intricate murals and hand-carved teak doors
tips: Less crowded than major temples - peaceful atmosphere.
Join evening chanting for authentic spiritual experience.
Giant Swing is best photographed in morning light.
Combine with nearby Wat Ratchabophit for full cultural day.

transportation.detail: Sam Yot Station (BL30), walk 10 mins.
From Khao San Road area, approx. 60-80 THB.

name: Wat Benchamabophit (Marble Temple)
thaiName: วัดเบญจมบพิตรดุสิตวนาราม
description: Thailand's most symmetrically perfect temple, built entirely from Italian Carrara marble with a gallery of 52 Buddha images from across Asia.
entranceFee: 100 THB (Foreigners), 50 THB (Some sources - bring 100 THB to be safe)
dressCode: Respectful attire required. Shoulders and knees must be covered.
highlights: Pure white Italian Carrara marble construction
52 Buddha statues from Thailand and abroad
tips: Visit early morning (06:00-07:00) to see monks' alms ceremony.
Less touristy than Grand Palace - great for photography.
Study the 52 different Buddha postures in the gallery.
Combine with nearby Dusit Zoo (if still open) or Ananta Samakhom.

transportation.detail: Phaya Thai Station, then taxi/Grab (10 mins).
Most convenient from central Bangkok.

name: Wat Paknam Phasi Charoen (Big Buddha)
thaiName: วัดปากน้ำภาษีเจริญ
description: Bangkok's newest landmark featuring a 69-meter golden Buddha statue and the stunning Emerald Crystal Chedi with cosmic ceiling murals.
address: 300 Ratchamongkhon Prasat Alley, Pak Khlong Phasi Charoen, Phasi Charoen, Bangkok 10160
dressCode: Respectful attire required. Shoulders and knees must be covered.
highlights: Emerald Crystal Chedi with cosmic ceiling art
Thonburi riverside location - changing Bangkok's tourism flow
tips: Construction fully complete as of 2025 - scaffolding removed.
Best photos from Soi Lat Ya 8 showing Buddha among old houses.
Visit Emerald Chedi on top floor - arrive early to avoid crowds.
Free entry makes it excellent value compared to other temples.

transportation.detail: Bang Phai Station (BL33), walk 10-15 mins.
Khlong Bangkok Yai boat to Wat Paknam Pier.
Set destination 'Wat Paknam Phasi Charoen'.

name: Wat Phra That Doi Suthep
thaiName: วัดพระธาตุดอยสุเทพ
description: The most sacred temple in Northern Thailand, sitting atop a mountain with breathtaking views of Chiang Mai city.
address: Suthep, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200
tips: Visit early morning for sunrise or evening for night view.
There is a cable car if you can't walk up the stairs.
Red trucks (Songthaew) are available from Chiang Mai Zoo.

transportation.detail: Take a Red Truck (Songthaew) from Chiang Mai Zoo (approx. 40-50 THB/person).
Charter a private Red Truck or Taxi from the city center (approx. 400-600 THB round trip).
Rent a motorbike and ride up (approx. 30-40 mins). Drive carefully!

name: Khao Soi Mae Sai
thaiName: ข้าวซอยแม่สาย
description: A local favorite spot serving authentic Northern Thai curry noodles (Khao Soi) with rich, creamy broth.
address: 29/1 Ratchaphuek Alley, Chang Phueak, Chiang Mai 50300
tips: Come before noon to avoid running out of soup.
Very affordable prices.
Parking is limited in the alley.

transportation.detail: Take a Red Truck to Santitham area or Kad Suan Kaew.
Search for 'Khao Soi Mae Sai' in Grab app.

name: Patong Beach
description: Phuket's most famous and developed beach, offering a wide variety of activities, nightlife, and dining options.
tips: Can be very crowded and noisy.
Always negotiate prices for tuk-tuks and goods.
Swimming is dangerous during monsoon season (red flags).

transportation.detail: Phuket Smart Bus stops at Patong (100 THB flat rate).
Convenient but can be pricey in Phuket. Check price before booking.
Motorbike taxi is the fastest way to get around Patong (starts 40-50 THB).

name: Old Phuket Town
thaiName: ย่านเมืองเก่าภูเก็ต
description: A historical area known for its well-preserved Sino-Portuguese shophouses, colorful buildings, and street art.
address: Thalang Road, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83000
tips: Sunday evening is the best time for the Walking Street market.
Great for photography.
Try local desserts like Oh Aew.

transportation.detail: Blue bus from any beach usually ends up in Phuket Town (Ranong Road).
Orange Airport Bus to Phuket Bus Terminal 1.
Easy to find from anywhere on the island.
